intro: Chamaedendron neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and a woody stem, making it a distinctive member of its native flora. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
